perturbation.original_text: Distributor is and shall remain an independent contractor. Distributor agrees that STAAR has granted it no authority to act or make any representations or warranties on behalf of STAAR.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor is and shall remain an affiliate of STAAR. Distributor agrees that STAAR has granted it the authority to act and make representations and warranties on behalf of STAAR.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the distributor as an 'independent contractor,' which implies they operate autonomously. The modified text redefines the distributor as an 'affiliate' and gives them authority to act on STAAR's behalf. This contradicts the established legal definition of 'independent contractor' under US law (and generally accepted business practices), where contractors are not agents of the principal company. An affiliate would have different liabilities and responsibilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law principles regarding agency and contract law, specifically the distinction between independent contractors and agents/affiliates.

perturbation.original_text: The term “Products” shall mean those certain products, specified by brand name, manufactured and marketed under the Trademarks by STAAR that are listed on Exhibit A-1 hereto. STAAR may from time to time modify or change the Products on Exhibit A-1 in its sole discretion, and if so, will notify Distributor promptly thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: The term “Products” shall mean those certain products, specified by brand name, manufactured and marketed under the Trademarks by STAAR that are listed on Exhibit A-1 hereto. STAAR will not modify or change the Products on Exhibit A-1 without the explicit written agreement of the distributor.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by removing STAAR's unilateral right to modify the product list. The initial agreement gives STAAR the power to modify the products in its sole discretion. The change removes the right of STAAR to change the products without the written agreement of the distributer, which alters the dynamics and is conflicting.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - specifically regarding unilateral modification clauses and potential issues of unconscionability if the power to modify the product line is critical to the distributor's business.

perturbation.original_text: STAAR shall have the option to repurchase any or all current and resalable Products in Distributor’s inventory at eighty percent (80%) of Distributor’s original net purchase price (reflecting a twenty percent (20%) restocking and administrative fee);
perturbation.changed_text: STAAR shall have the option to repurchase any or all current and resalable Products in Distributor’s inventory at forty percent (40%) of Distributor’s original net purchase price (reflecting a sixty percent (60%) restocking and administrative fee);
perturbation.explanation: The change in this section drastically alters the repurchase price, which could be considered unconscionable. While contract law generally allows parties to agree to terms, extreme imbalances in bargaining power leading to unfair outcomes can be challenged. Reducing the repurchase price to 40% while increasing the 'restocking and administrative fee' to 60% raises questions about the fairness and enforceability of this clause, especially if the distributor is heavily reliant on this repurchase agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - specifically regarding clauses that are unconscionable or violate the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing. Also, potential violation of state-specific franchise laws if this distributorship agreement is deemed a franchise.
